segment.source: Target platform on MSDN driver reference pages
segment.target: Target platform on MSDN driver reference pages

segment.source: In the Requirements block at the bottom of MSDN driver reference pages, you'll see an entry called Target Platform.
segment.target: In the Requirements block at the bottom of MSDN driver reference pages, you'll see an entry called Target Platform.

segment.source: This line lists editions of Windows to which the page applies.
segment.target: This line lists editions of Windows to which the page applies.

segment.source: Here's an example of such an entry:
segment.target: Here's an example of such an entry:

segment.source: Target Platform set to universal in Requirements block
segment.target: Target Platform set to universal in Requirements block

segment.source: The values specified in Target Platform map to the values you can use in Visual Studio, in the Target Platform property under Configuration Properties->Driver .
segment.target: The values specified in Target Platform map to the values you can use in Visual Studio, in the Target Platform property under Configuration Properties->Driver .

segment.source: Here are the values you might see for Target Platform on MSDN, and what they mean:
segment.target: Here are the values you might see for Target Platform on MSDN, and what they mean:

segment.source: Term
segment.target: Term

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Universal
segment.target: Universal

segment.source: A Universal Windows driver can call this device driver interface (DDI).
segment.target: A Universal Windows driver can call this device driver interface (DDI).

segment.source: A Universal Windows driver runs on the following Universal Windows Platform (UWP)-based editions of Windows 10:
segment.target: A Universal Windows driver runs on the following Universal Windows Platform (UWP)-based editions of Windows 10:

segment.source: Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, and Enterprise)
segment.target: Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, and Enterprise)

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Windows 10 IoT Core
segment.target: Windows 10 IoT Core

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: For more info, see Getting Started with Universal Windows drivers.
segment.target: For more info, see Getting Started with Universal Windows drivers.

segment.source: Desktop
segment.target: Desktop

segment.source: A driver for Windows 10 for desktop editions or Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview can call this DDI.
segment.target: A driver for Windows 10 for desktop editions or Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview can call this DDI.

segment.source: Mobile
segment.target: Mobile

segment.source: A driver for Windows 10 Mobile can call this DDI.
segment.target: A driver for Windows 10 Mobile can call this DDI.
